item.description:
Hi Film fans,

This movie will be hosted by Susan and will be screened at the lovely new ICA on the waterfront. Here's a description from their website: Alice Neel
This new feature-length documentary tells the story of American painter Alice Neel (1900-1984). Exploring the struggles Alice Neel faced as a woman, a single mother and a painter who defied conventions, the film uses a mix of old family photographs, historical footage and newly filmed interviews. With an appearance by the filmmaker, Andrew Neel, Alice Neel?s grandson.

If you haven't been to the museum yet, here's a link to their website for directions and other info: http://www.icaboston....

Also, here's a link to a review in the NY Times that another member thoughtfully included in her message on our web site message board. http://movies2.nytime...

There's a cafe at the museum where we can enjoy a discussion afterwards. Looking forward to meetingup with you. Susan
item.name: Documentary about American painter Alice Neel
